intro: Tapeinostemon breweri, commonly known as the Breweri's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to purple flowers that bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and slightly hairy, while its vines can climb or trail along the ground. Tapeinostemon breweri is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions.
